title: Axiom Space revises space station assembly plans
summary:
Axiom Space is revising the assembly sequence for its commercial space station, a move it says will allow it to get to a free-flying station sooner while addressing NASA’s needs to prepare for the deorbiting of the ISS.
The post Axiom Space revises space station assembly plans appeared first on SpaceNews.

title: SpaceX launches redesigned O3b mPower satellites
summary:
SpaceX successfully launched the first pair of O3b mPower satellites with fixes to address power issues that have hampered the initial six in SES’s next-generation medium Earth orbit broadband network.
The post SpaceX launches redesigned O3b mPower satellites appeared first on SpaceNews.

title: Second Kairos launch fails
summary:
The second flight of a Japanese small launch vehicle failed when the vehicle lost control a couple minutes after its Dec. 17 liftoff.
The post Second Kairos launch fails appeared first on SpaceNews.

title: A fall of CubeSats
summary: Four pioneering ESA Technology CubeSats reentered Earth’s atmosphere over the last few months. Each was only about the size of a shoebox or smaller, but despite their diminutive dimensions the missions left an outsize legacy in terms of demonstrating innovative space technology, industrial capacity building and scientific data return.
